attributes.action: drastically reduce the remuneration (pay, pension & bonus) received by Royal Mail senior management.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Adam Crozier (chief executive) alone has a salary of £633,000 and the new chairman appointed in early 2009, Donald Brydon, earns £200,000 for a two day week. Adam Crozier’s total remuneration last year was over £3million. Adam Crozier’s bonus for 2008-2009 was £453,000, £314,000 of which was put into a long term bonus scheme to enable it to grow by a third if targets are hit for the next two years or double if performance is ‘outstanding‘. 

The Prime Minister has been petitioned as head of the Government which owns Royal Mail and in view of the recent announcements made by the Government in relation to the pay and pensions of public sector employees.
